heading: Tuesday Night
text: Cloudy. Snow likely, except tapering off near and south of Route 4 after midnight; some wintry mix possible in the southern Greens and Berkshires; 1 to 4 inches of snow, and locally higher amounts in the northern mountains. Lows from the mid 20s to around 30 south, and upper teens to mid 20s north, with some lower 20s far north. Southeast 5 to 10 mph, becoming northwest late.

heading: Wednesday
text: Decreasing clouds west and south. Mostly cloudy from the northern Greens eastward, with scattered snow showers, mainly in the morning; another trace to 2 inches, mainly over high terrain. Highs from the upper 20s to mid 30s in the south, and mid 20s to around 30 north. Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph in the morning, except gusting to 40 mph far south.

heading: Wednesday Night
text: Partly to mostly cloudy. Lows mainly in the upper teens to lower 20s, with low to mid teens northeast, and mid 20s in the broad valleys west. Winds light and variable.
